snippet: The musical retelling of the life of the nation’s first Treasury secretary is poised to become not only a hit, but a turning point for the art form and a cultural conversation piece.
abstract: Hip-hop musical Hamilton, bold retelling of life of nation's first Treasury secretary, is poised to make big impact in its Broadway debut; show, created by Lin-Manuel Miranda, has already sold some 200,000 tickets in advance, and has been heralded as turning point for the medium; questions remain about whether play will have staying power among tourist theatergoers.
lead_paragraph: The musical retelling of the life of the nation’s first Treasury secretary is poised to become not only a hit, but a turning point for the art form and a cultural conversation piece.

headline.main: ‘Hamilton’ Heads to Broadway in a Hip-Hop Retelling
headline.print_headline: A Hip-Hop Musical on Hamilton Is Put to the Test on Broadway
